comments.author: eaLiTy
comments.body: Quote from: Betwrong on October 12, 2022, 10:38:52 AM~a good source of info, or should I watch/read something else?The video brushes a few laws but it basically says the history of the game and it is a good video but since you are trying to learn the gameThe Laws of Cricket Explained which is a great video for any novice to understand the game better and then after having an idea about the rules watch some match highlights which is available online and you will figure out the game step by step. Basically there are three formats of the game, Test match which will last 5 days and each team gets 2 innings each, unlimited overs for a bowler and 90 overs for the day. After the fifth day if there is no result it is considered a drawODI matches, 50 overs a team and a bowler could bowl a maximum of 10 oversT20 matches 20 overs a team and a bowler could bowl a maximum of 4 oversIf both teams score exactly the same runs then it would be a tie and in T20 there will be a super over, which means one over will be bowled by each team and the team that scores the maximum runs will be the winner.The rest is explained in the video above and you will understand once you understand the laws or if you have any questions there are a lot of Cricket fans in this forum who could clear every doubt  .
